text.front:
HYDROBIOL. BULL. 25(2), 145-149 (1991)
HETEROTROPHIC BACTERIAL PRODUCTION IN LAKE XOLOTI..AN
(MANAGUA) DURING 1988-1989
RUSSELL T. BELL 1, ROLF ERIKSON 1, KATHLEEN VAMMEN, MARIA HELENA VARGAS
and ARGENTINA ZELAYA
KEYWORDS: heterotrophic bacterioplankton, biomass, production, tropical lake
ABSTRACT
The biomass and production (thymidine incorporation) of heterotrophic bacterioplankton has been
assessed from July, 1988, to October,1989, in Lake Xolotl~n, Nicaragua. Bacterial abundance was high,
2-3.10 lo cells.1-1, and bacterial biomass averaged ca. 0.75 mg C.1-1, or roughly 20% of the particuJate organic
carbon. Bacterial production averaged between 3.5-5 l~g C.1-1.h-1 and on an areal basis was 650-959 mg
C.m-2.d-1 or 13-20% of the primary production. Although bacterial production (volumetric basis) was typical
for eutrophic lakes, the bacterial specific growh rate was low, the bacterial population doubling time was ca. 1
week, perhaps indicating that there was a low grazing pressure on the bacteria.
145
Addresses of the authors:
CENTRO PARA LA INVESTIGAClON EN RECURSOS ACUATICOS DE NICARAGUA (CIRA),
